page.title: 01FARMING IN LOCHANS
page.content:
{ CAIRNPAT FARM}is situated 1.5Km south-west of{LOCHANS}village. It covers an area of 94.8 Hectares; of which 64 Hectares is silage arable, leaving 30.8 Ha of rough grazing.
The farm carries a herd of 130 dairy Fresians as well as 150 Hereford-cross Beef cattle. The 150 Beefcattle graze the rough pasture on the slopes of Cairnpat hill while the dairy cattle graze the better pasture. They also receive a small amount of cattle cake in the milk parlour. All the cattle are fed silage as a fodder crop during the winter. The dairy cattle are milked in a low line{HOSEIAR}milking parlour. The milk is then transferred to 700 gallon bulk tank, before being taken away in the milk tanker. The grass is cut for silage by a contractor.
